projectPurpose: To provide Rust developers with a flexible, lightweight library for creating interactive terminal user interfaces (TUIs), focusing on the rendering aspect while allowing developers to handle input and application state separately.
platforms: Cross-platform (where Rust and supported backends run)
mainFeatures: Provides a set of widgets and utilities
Based on immediate rendering with intermediate buffers
Supports different terminal backends (Crossterm, Termion, Termwiz)

alternatives.name: ncurses
mainFeatures: Includes panel, menu, and form libraries

alternatives.name: Textual
mainFeatures: Inspired by modern web development (CSS for layout)
Runs in the terminal and web browser

marketPositioning: Ratatui positions itself as a core, lightweight TUI rendering library for the Rust ecosystem. As a fork of tui-rs, it emphasizes continued development and community contributions. Unlike higher-level frameworks that may include built-in event loops or application structures, Ratatui focuses on providing a robust set of widgets and layout tools with an immediate rendering model. This approach gives developers maximum flexibility and control over their application's architecture, event handling, and state management, making it a preferred choice for Rust developers who need a powerful rendering engine without the constraints of a full framework.
